intro.description: This is a summary of relevant regulations for the cabin generation taken from the EASA CS-25/Amendment 15 "Certification Specifications and Acceptable Means of Compliance for Large Aeroplanes" (07/21/2014)

item.title: CS 25.785 Seats, berths, safety belts and harnesses
item.description:
(a) A seat (or berth for a non-ambulant person) must be provided for each occupant who has reached his or her second birthday.
(d) Each occupant of a seat (see AMC 25.785(d)) that makes more than an 18-degree angle with the vertical plane containing the aeroplane centreline must be protected from head injury by a safety belt and an energy absorbing rest that will support the arms, shoulders, head and spine, or by a safety belt and shoulder harness that will prevent the head from contacting any injurious object. Each occupant of any other seat must be protected from head injury by a safety belt and, as appropriate to the type, location, and angle of facing of each seat, by one or more of the following:
(1) A shoulder harness that will prevent the head from contacting any injurious object.
(2) The elimination of any injurious object within striking radius of the head.
(3) An energy absorbing rest that will support the arms, shoulders, head and spine.

item.title: CS 25.787 Stowage compartments
item.description: If the aeroplane has a passenger-seating configuration, excluding pilot seats, of 10 seats or more, each stowage compartment in the passenger cabin, except for under seat and overhead compartments for passenger convenience, must be completely enclosed.
